actions.name: AssociateConfigurationItemsToApplication
actions.description: Associates one or more configuration items with an application.

actions.name: BatchDeleteImportData
actions.description: Deletes one or more Migration Hub import tasks, each identified by their import ID. Each import task has a number of records, which can identify servers or applications.

actions.name: CreateApplication
actions.description: Creates an application with the given name and description.

actions.name: CreateTags
actions.description: Creates one or more tags for configuration items. Tags are metadata that help you categorize IT assets. This API accepts a list of multiple configuration items.

actions.name: DeleteApplications
actions.description: Deletes a list of applications and their associations with configuration items.

actions.name: DeleteTags
actions.description: Deletes the association between configuration items and one or more tags. This API accepts a list of multiple configuration items.

actions.name: DescribeAgents
actions.description: Lists agents or the Connector by ID or lists all agents/Connectors associated with your user account if you did not specify an ID.

actions.name: DescribeConfigurations
actions.description: Retrieves attributes for a list of configuration item IDs. All of the supplied IDs must be for the same asset type (server, application, process, or connection). Output fields are specific to the asset type selected. For example, the output for a server configuration item includes a list of attributes about the server, such as host name, operating system, and number of network cards.

actions.name: DescribeContinuousExports
actions.description: Lists exports as specified by ID. All continuous exports associated with your user account can be listed if you call DescribeContinuousExports as is without passing any parameters.

actions.name: DescribeExportConfigurations
actions.description: Retrieves the status of a given export process. You can retrieve status from a maximum of 100 processes.

actions.name: DescribeExportTasks
actions.description: Retrieve status of one or more export tasks. You can retrieve the status of up to 100 export tasks.

actions.name: DescribeImportTasks
actions.description: Returns an array of import tasks for your account, including status information, times, IDs, the Amazon S3 Object URL for the import file, and more.

actions.name: DescribeTags
actions.description: Retrieves a list of configuration items that are tagged with a specific tag. Or retrieves a list of all tags assigned to a specific configuration item.

actions.name: DisassociateConfigurationItemsFromApplication
actions.description: Disassociates one or more configuration items from an application.

actions.name: ExportConfigurations
actions.description: Exports all discovered configuration data to an Amazon S3 bucket or an application that enables you to view and evaluate the data. Data includes tags and tag associations, processes, connections, servers, and system performance.

actions.name: GetDiscoverySummary
actions.description: Retrieves a short summary of discovered assets.

actions.name: ListConfigurations
actions.description: Retrieves a list of configuration items according to criteria you specify in a filter. The filter criteria identify relationship requirements.

actions.name: ListServerNeighbors
actions.description: Retrieves a list of servers which are one network hop away from a specified server.

actions.name: StartContinuousExport
actions.description: Start the continuous flow of agent's discovered data into Amazon Athena.

actions.name: StartDataCollectionByAgentIds
actions.description: Instructs the specified agents or Connectors to start collecting data.

actions.name: StartExportTask
actions.description: Export the configuration data about discovered configuration items and relationships to an S3 bucket in a specified format.

actions.name: StartImportTask
actions.description: Starts an import task. The Migration Hub import feature allows you to import details of your on-premises environment directly into AWS without having to use the Application Discovery Service (ADS) tools such as the Discovery Connector or Discovery Agent. This gives you the option to perform migration assessment and planning directly from your imported data including the ability to group your devices as applications and track their migration status.

actions.name: StopContinuousExport
actions.description: Stop the continuous flow of agent's discovered data into Amazon Athena.

actions.name: StopDataCollectionByAgentIds
actions.description: Instructs the specified agents or Connectors to stop collecting data.

actions.name: UpdateApplication
actions.description: Updates metadata about an application.
